description: Social work majors study the methods and skills of social work practice, particularly intercultural communication. They describe strengths and problems of diverse individuals and families; frame goals and plans for change utilizing the planned change process and the systems perspective; and use ethical decision-making, informed by the scientific method, grounded in the liberal arts, and concerned with social justice. Students demonstrate learning in recorded role playing and have an academic civic engagement experience. Prerequisites: SWRK 221 and concurrent enrollment in SWRK 246. Offered annually in the fall semester.
name: Incl Pract: Ind/Fam
notes: Open to Junior Social Work majors only.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: SWRK 221 and concurrent enrollment in SWRK 246. Offered annually in the fall semester.
title: Inclusive Practice: Individuals and Families
